alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 4:31AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Crawford and southern Washington Counties through 500 AM CDT... At 431 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 3 miles west of Strickler, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Mountainburg... West Fork... Winslow... Chester... Devils Den State Park... Brentwood... Lake Fort Smith... Strickler... Blackburn... Wyola... Woolsey... Clyde... Canehill... Hogeye... Mount Gayler... Morrow... This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 33 and 51. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM CDT for northwestern Arkansas.
